verse: The Lord spoke this word to Jeremiah the prophet about the nations [chapters 46–51 are oracles against the foreign nations; see also Is. 13–23; Ezek. 25–32; Amos 1–2; Nah.; Obad.]:

This message is to Egypt. It is about the army of Neco king of Egypt [ruled 610–595 bc], which ·was defeated at [struck] the city of Carchemish on the Euphrates River by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. This was in the fourth year that Jehoiakim son of Josiah was king of Judah [605 bc]. This is the Lord’s message to Egypt:
This is the message the Lord spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon’s coming to ·attack [strike] Egypt:

The Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], the God of Israel, says: “Very soon I will punish Amon, the god of the city of Thebes [a sun god]. And I will punish Egypt, her ·kings [Pharaohs], her gods, and the people who ·depend on [have confidence in] the king.

I will hand those people over to ·their enemies, who want to kill them [those who seek their life]. I will give them to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his ·officers [servants]. But in the future, Egypt will live as it once did of old [in peace],” says the Lord.
